commit_message:
Add `plugins` option to enable horizon plugins

`plugins` config option is a json list, containing plugin names.
Removing plugins from the list will disable them.

Change-Id: I0e25a8b2db2f12272ece343076a51bb8bf365653
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/charm-horizon-k8s refs/changes/16/892916/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import jsonfrom typing import List self._state.set_default(plugins=[]) def configure_unit(self, event: ops.framework.EventBase) -> None: super().configure_unit(event) self.configure_plugins(event) def configure_plugins(self, event: ops.framework.EventBase) -> None: plugins = json.loads(self.config.get("plugins", "[]")) container = self.model.unit.get_container(self.service_name) if not container.can_connect(): logger.debug("Container not ready, skipping plugin configuration") return old_plugins = self._state.plugins disabled_plugins = set(old_plugins) - set(plugins) any_changes = False if disabled_plugins: cmd = "/usr/bin/plugin_management.py disable " + " ".join( disabled_plugins ) process = container.exec(cmd.split(), timeout=5 * 60) out, _ = process.wait_output() any_changes |= "Disabled" in out if plugins: cmd = "/usr/bin/plugin_management.py enable " + " ".join(plugins) process = container.exec(cmd.split(), timeout=5 * 60) out, _ = process.wait_output() any_changes |= "Enabled" in out self._state.plugins = plugins if any_changes: container.restart("wsgi-" + self.service_name)

commit_message:
Release final python-cyborgclient for 2023.2 Bobcat

This is a release for python-cyborgclient to get any merged but
unreleased changes out prior to the client lib freeze for 2023.2 Bobcat
going into effect.

If the team is ready to proceed, please leave a +1 to acknowledge this
release and we will process right away. If the team is working on any
final merges, leave a -1 with some detail on the status and update the
patch with the new commit hash to use when ready.

Patches with no response will be merged by Friday, September 1st.

$ git log --oneline --no-merges 2.2.0..51c06d5
51c06d5 add nagative unittest for program deployable in cyborg module
dfff421 add negative unittest for deployable program in cyborg module
0d04902 add unittest for program deployable in cyborg module
f397f0d add unittest for delete accelerator with instance uuid
4a99d71 add unittest for show device profile with not exist id
f07398d add unittest for show device profile with id
f4331b8 line too long

Change-Id: I9c480456d3cf3891319cad859adb618ce9d5b6d9
Signed-off-by: Hervé Beraud <hberaud@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Integrate mypy type checker

Use mypy for type checking Octavia code.

- Add octavia-mypy job
- Add new mypy tox testenv
- Fix mypy errors

Test code is excluded from checks.

Closes-Bug: #2017974
Change-Id: Id8b1c2109abd199b13374094ea64a4cacb34085b

commit_message:
Fix image race condition

It has been observed that some glance related jobs like
glance-multistore-cinder-import, nova-ceph-multistore are
failing with race condition while saving image data [1].

To avoid this race condition sending image_id while creating
the image so that it will be ensured that each test can
utilize own image.

[1] https://etherpad.opendev.org/p/glance-temepst-race

Change-Id: I235b2c253887d61dd97acfb4e9fff3186ed0d61b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/31/892731/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if 'id' not in kwargs: image_id = data_utils.rand_uuid() kwargs['id'] = image_id

commit_message:
Allow restricting access rules fields and deletion

Access rules rules allow API will now take three additional
parameters:

- lock_visibility: when True, only services, administrators and
  the same user will be able to see the content of ``access_to`` and
  access_key.

- lock_deletion: when True, the access rule will be locked for
  deletion. Only services, administrators or the user that placed
  the lock will be able to drop the access rule.

- lock_reason: a reason for the lock. This parameter should only
  be provided in the presence of at least one of the former
  parameters.

In order to delete an access rule that is currently locked, the
requester will need to specify ``unrestrict=True`` in the request.

In case a service placed the restrictions, only the own service or
the system administrator will be able to release it.

This change also implements filters to the access list API. It is
now possible to filter access rules based on `access_to`,
`access_type`, `access_level` and `access_key`.

DocImpact

Change-Id: Iea422c9d6bc99a81cd88c5f4b7055d6a1cf97fdc
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/manila refs/changes/25/887725/20 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if req.api_version_request >= api_version.APIVersionRequest("2.80"): access_data = body.get('allow_access') restricted = access_data.get('restricted', False) kwargs['restricted'] = restricted

commit_message:
Fix linters to satisfy ansible-lint 6.18

With update of ansible-lint to version >=6.0.0 a lot of new
linters were added, that enabled by default. In order to comply
with linter rules we're applying changes to the role.

Update of linters version is required for bumping ansible-core
version.

Change-Id: Icb7d9906bdc3dcb50c44c67881c2078ade8b72f2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/27/886527/20 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: export ANSIBLE_PACKAGE=${ANSIBLE_PACKAGE:-"ansible-core==2.15.1"}

subject: Refactor LXC image expiration
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2023-08-22 13:30:39.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/fix_lxc_cache_expiration-1656b5758c4ec24e.yaml', 'tasks/lxc_cache.yml', 'tasks/lxc_cache_create.yml', 'defaults/main.yml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-lxc_hosts/commit/66021a200c1a91b3e05814b3639aedd131234dfa', 'message': 'Refactor LXC image expiration

Right now we write output of `date -d @{{ timestamp }} to
the expiry file, and then attempt to comapre with timestamp.
However, output of  `date -d` is datetime and not timestamp,
so these 2 things can not be properly compared. So image cache
was valid forever.

Change-Id: I42f5b43f09d3c530813dd7fd334eafce7a5eaf39
(cherry picked from commit a51291f87d44a126f432bafbfd68f6fe3cd1ba1d)
'}]
commit_message:
Refactor LXC image expiration

Right now we write output of `date -d @{{ timestamp }} to
the expiry file, and then attempt to comapre with timestamp.
However, output of  `date -d` is datetime and not timestamp,
so these 2 things can not be properly compared. So image cache
was valid forever.

Change-Id: I42f5b43f09d3c530813dd7fd334eafce7a5eaf39
(cherry picked from commit a51291f87d44a126f432bafbfd68f6fe3cd1ba1d)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-lxc_hosts refs/changes/11/892311/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Expiration timeout for the cached image # Should be in format supported by the to_time_unit filter lxc_image_cache_expiration: "1year"

commit_message:
[NetApp] Recreate security cert during vserver create.

The certificate is automatically created on NetApp with 1 year i.e. 365
days of expiration time, and admin needs to manually extend it. It would
be nice Manila can take care to create certs with admin configuable
expiration time. Manila should first create the new cert with given
expiration time and if successful, delete the old cert.

Closes-bug: #2011693
Change-Id: I37e52b94dc492e91fe9e673b3619e6716737d39a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/manila refs/changes/15/877615/11 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: set(fake.AGGREGATES), fake.IPSPACE, fake.SECURITY_CERT_EXPIRE_DAYS)

commit_message:
Add an option to randomize LDAP urls list

Since LDAP is now readonly, the current behavior might be
unexpected. By randomizing the list, we assure a more gradual
failure scenario if the first server on the list (as specified
by the user) fails.

Change-Id: I23f31bd85443784013a6aa158d80c7aeeb343993
Closes-Bug: #1953622
Resolves: rhbz#2024602
(cherry picked from commit 36d57d2a83a2a4a905337239d1a57d2e6a61c842)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/59/892759/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- features: - | A new option 'randomize_urls' can be used to randomize the order in which keystone connects to the LDAP servers in [ldap] 'url' list. It is false by default.

commit_message:
Run cs9 content provider on wallaby branch only

Currently tripleo-ci-centos-9-content-provider[1] job is running on
master branch in periodic and check line. TripleO job is no longer
maintained after stable/wallaby branch. CS9 content provider
is failing on above branch which is a wastage of resources.

It needs to be run on cs9 wallaby and train only.

Note: To avoid
freeze job graph: Job tripleo-ci-centos-9-containers-multinode-wallaby
depends on tripleo-ci-centos-9-content-provider-wallaby which was
not run issue. We need to change the parent of cs9 content
provider wallaby otherwise we still hit same issue otherwise cs9
content provider branches will come into play leading to freeze issue.

[1]. https://zuul.opendev.org/t/openstack/builds?job_name=tripleo-ci-centos-9-content-provider&branch=master&skip=0

Change-Id: Ib2f73b214a87ac9f89521ab5b6ff28973536d462
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ci refs/changes/40/892740/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: branches: ^(stable/(train|wallaby)).*$

This proposed a release for oslo.limit to get any final merged
changes out prior to the lib freeze for 2023.2 Bobcat going into effect.

If the team is ready to proceed, please leave a +1 to acknowledge this
release and we will process right away. If the team is working on any
final merges, leave a -1 with some detail on the status and update the
patch with the new commit hash to use when ready.

Patches with no response will be merged by Friday, August 25th.

$ git log --oneline --no-merges 2.1.0..c9ee0ad

fc64349 Revert "Moves supported python runtimes from version 3.8 to 3.10"
886e717 Moves supported python runtimes from version 3.8 to 3.10
de69de1 Update master for stable/2023.1

Change-Id: I5169efcc9244d825171bde286f8af25ec6bc9ac8

commit_message:
Refactor LXC image expiration

Right now we write output of `date -d @{{ timestamp }} to
the expiry file, and then attempt to comapre with timestamp.
However, output of  `date -d` is datetime and not timestamp,
so these 2 things can not be properly compared. So image cache
was valid forever.

Change-Id: I42f5b43f09d3c530813dd7fd334eafce7a5eaf39
(cherry picked from commit a51291f87d44a126f432bafbfd68f6fe3cd1ba1d)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-lxc_hosts refs/changes/13/892313/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Expiration timeout for the cached image # Should be in format supported by the to_time_unit filter lxc_image_cache_expiration: "1year"

commit_message:
Add member test with multiple subnets on same network

Add test_member_network_with_multiple_subnets
It ensures that the VIP/members subnets are correctly plugged/unplugged
into/from the ports of the amphora.

Story: 2004112
Task: 46250

Change-Id: Iffd6c1e7922dac0f098c9d150c746c7f3e36cbe1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/octavia-tempest-plugin refs/changes/13/815313/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def resource_setup(cls, extra_subnets=False): super(MemberScenarioTest, cls).resource_setup( extra_subnets) class MemberScenarioTestMultipleSubnets(MemberScenarioTest): @classmethod def resource_setup(cls): super(MemberScenarioTestMultipleSubnets, cls).resource_setup( extra_subnets=True) def _member_add(self, pool_id, subnet_id, ip_address): member_name = data_utils.rand_name("lb_member_member1-create") member_kwargs = { const.NAME: member_name, const.ADMIN_STATE_UP: True, const.POOL_ID: pool_id, const.ADDRESS: ip_address, const.SUBNET_ID: subnet_id, const.PROTOCOL_PORT: 80, const.WEIGHT: 50, } member = self.mem_member_client.create_member( **member_kwargs) self.addCleanup( self.mem_member_client.cleanup_member, member[const.ID], pool_id=pool_id, lb_client=self.mem_lb_client, lb_id=self.lb_id) waiters.wait_for_status( self.mem_lb_client.show_loadbalancer, self.lb_id, const.PROVISIONING_STATUS, const.ACTIVE, CONF.load_balancer.check_interval, CONF.load_balancer.check_timeout) return member def _member_delete(self, pool_id, member_id): self.mem_member_client.delete_member( member_id, pool_id=pool_id) waiters.wait_for_deleted_status_or_not_found( self.mem_member_client.show_member, member_id, const.PROVISIONING_STATUS, CONF.load_balancer.check_interval, CONF.load_balancer.check_timeout, pool_id=pool_id) waiters.wait_for_status( self.mem_lb_client.show_loadbalancer, self.lb_id, const.PROVISIONING_STATUS, const.ACTIVE, CONF.load_balancer.check_interval, CONF.load_balancer.check_timeout) def _get_ports(self, compute_id): return self.lb_mem_ports_client.list_ports( device_id=compute_id)['ports'] def _get_subnet_ids_from_ports(self, ports): return [ fixed_ip[const.SUBNET_ID] for port in ports for fixed_ip in port['fixed_ips'] ] @decorators.idempotent_id('d8f45537-0538-43dc-9dc3-8e753b8e6a75') def test_member_network_with_multiple_subnets(self): pool_id = self._listener_pool_create( const.HTTP, const.HTTP, const.LB_ALGORITHM_ROUND_ROBIN) amphorae = self.lb_admin_amphora_client.list_amphorae( query_params='{loadbalancer_id}={lb_id}'.format( loadbalancer_id=const.LOADBALANCER_ID, lb_id=self.lb_id)) amphora = amphorae[0] compute_id = amphora[const.COMPUTE_ID] # Get ports and subnets # only VIP subnet/network is plugged ports = self._get_ports(compute_id) port_subnet_ids = self._get_subnet_ids_from_ports(ports) self.assertEqual(1, len(ports)) self.assertEqual(1, len(port_subnet_ids)) self.assertIn(self.lb_member_vip_subnet[const.ID], port_subnet_ids) # Create a member on the 2nd VIP subnet member1 = self._member_add( pool_id, self.lb_member_vip_subnet2[const.ID], '10.1.0.1') # Get ports and subnets # the VIP network is plugged with 2 subnets ports = self._get_ports(compute_id) port_subnet_ids = self._get_subnet_ids_from_ports(ports) self.assertEqual(1, len(ports)) self.assertIn(self.lb_member_vip_subnet[const.ID], port_subnet_ids) self.assertIn(self.lb_member_vip_subnet2[const.ID], port_subnet_ids) # Create a member on the member_1 subnet member2 = self._member_add( pool_id, self.lb_member_1_subnet[const.ID], '10.2.0.1') # Get ports and subnets # the VIP network is plugged with 2 subnets # member_1 subnet has been added ports = self._get_ports(compute_id) port_subnet_ids = self._get_subnet_ids_from_ports(ports) self.assertEqual(2, len(ports)) self.assertIn(self.lb_member_vip_subnet[const.ID], port_subnet_ids) self.assertIn(self.lb_member_vip_subnet2[const.ID], port_subnet_ids) self.assertIn(self.lb_member_1_subnet[const.ID], port_subnet_ids) # Create a member on member_2 subnet member3 = self._member_add( pool_id, self.lb_member_2_subnet[const.ID], '10.3.0.1') # Get ports and subnets # the VIP network is plugged with 2 subnets # member_1 subnet is plugged # member_2 subnet has been added ports = self._get_ports(compute_id) port_subnet_ids = self._get_subnet_ids_from_ports(ports) self.assertEqual(3, len(ports)) self.assertIn(self.lb_member_vip_subnet[const.ID], port_subnet_ids) self.assertIn(self.lb_member_vip_subnet2[const.ID], port_subnet_ids) self.assertIn(self.lb_member_1_subnet[const.ID], port_subnet_ids) self.assertIn(self.lb_member_2_subnet[const.ID], port_subnet_ids) # Create a member on the 2nd member_1 subnet member4 = self._member_add( pool_id, self.lb_member_1_subnet2[const.ID], '10.4.0.1') # Get ports and subnets # the VIP network is plugged with 2 subnets # 2 subnets on member_1 are plugged # member_2 subnet is plugged ports = self._get_ports(compute_id) port_subnet_ids = self._get_subnet_ids_from_ports(ports) self.assertEqual(3, len(ports)) self.assertIn(self.lb_member_vip_subnet[const.ID], port_subnet_ids) self.assertIn(self.lb_member_vip_subnet2[const.ID], port_subnet_ids) self.assertIn(self.lb_member_1_subnet[const.ID], port_subnet_ids) self.assertIn(self.lb_member_2_subnet[const.ID], port_subnet_ids) self.assertIn(self.lb_member_1_subnet2[const.ID], port_subnet_ids) # Delete the member plugged on the 2nd VIP subnet self._member_delete(pool_id, member1[const.ID]) # Get ports and subnets # the VIP network is still plugged with 1 subnet # 2 subnets on member_1 are plugged # member_2 subnet is plugged ports = self._get_ports(compute_id) port_subnet_ids = self._get_subnet_ids_from_ports(ports) self.assertEqual(3, len(ports)) self.assertIn(self.lb_member_vip_subnet[const.ID], port_subnet_ids) self.assertNotIn(self.lb_member_vip_subnet2[const.ID], port_subnet_ids) self.assertIn(self.lb_member_1_subnet[const.ID], port_subnet_ids) self.assertIn(self.lb_member_2_subnet[const.ID], port_subnet_ids) self.assertIn(self.lb_member_1_subnet2[const.ID], port_subnet_ids) # Delete the member plugged on member_1 subnet self._member_delete(pool_id, member2[const.ID]) # Get ports and subnets # the VIP network is still plugged with 1 subnet # 2nd member_1 subnet is plugged # member_2 subnet is plugged ports = self._get_ports(compute_id) port_subnet_ids = self._get_subnet_ids_from_ports(ports) self.assertEqual(3, len(ports)) self.assertIn(self.lb_member_vip_subnet[const.ID], port_subnet_ids) self.assertNotIn(self.lb_member_vip_subnet2[const.ID], port_subnet_ids) self.assertNotIn(self.lb_member_1_subnet[const.ID], port_subnet_ids) self.assertIn(self.lb_member_2_subnet[const.ID], port_subnet_ids) self.assertIn(self.lb_member_1_subnet2[const.ID], port_subnet_ids) # Delete the member plugged on member_2 subnet self._member_delete(pool_id, member3[const.ID]) # Get ports and subnets # the VIP network is still plugged with 1 subnet # 2nd member_1 subnet is plugged ports = self._get_ports(compute_id) port_subnet_ids = self._get_subnet_ids_from_ports(ports) self.assertEqual(2, len(ports)) self.assertIn(self.lb_member_vip_subnet[const.ID], port_subnet_ids) self.assertNotIn(self.lb_member_vip_subnet2[const.ID], port_subnet_ids) self.assertNotIn(self.lb_member_1_subnet[const.ID], port_subnet_ids) self.assertNotIn(self.lb_member_2_subnet[const.ID], port_subnet_ids) self.assertIn(self.lb_member_1_subnet2[const.ID], port_subnet_ids) # Delete the member plugged on 2nd member_1 subnet self._member_delete(pool_id, member4[const.ID]) # Get ports and subnets # the VIP network is still plugged with 1 subnet ports = self._get_ports(compute_id) port_subnet_ids = self._get_subnet_ids_from_ports(ports) self.assertEqual(1, len(ports)) self.assertIn(self.lb_member_vip_subnet[const.ID], port_subnet_ids) self.assertNotIn(self.lb_member_vip_subnet2[const.ID], port_subnet_ids) self.assertNotIn(self.lb_member_1_subnet[const.ID], port_subnet_ids) self.assertNotIn(self.lb_member_2_subnet[const.ID], port_subnet_ids) self.assertNotIn(self.lb_member_1_subnet2[const.ID], port_subnet_ids)

commit_message:
DNM: Test gate jobs with GLOBAL_VENV=true

This patch try to find other issues when "Set GLOBAL_VENV=true".

1: Apply aodh's patch [1] that  fix for GLOBAL_VENV issue of aodh.
2: Rely on PATH env set by devstack.
   This fix is based on devstack patch [2] change.
3: Set "GLOBAL_VENV=false" only on the controller-k8s node to avoid
   the issue of setup on kuryr-kubernetes.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/aodh/+/891576
[2] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/devstack/+/892848

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/aodh/+/891576
Change-Id: I6e1a6ff2bf39de480c230539c7e2c7b4c2a51a44

commit_message:
tests: Move cloud-layer service tests to their own file

This mirrors how we do unit testing elsewhere, with the test module's
path mirroring the module-under-test's path.

Change-Id: I0382c5bb0d86431f6f7520b16881360477eb2658

commit_message:
Allow restricting access rules

Access rules can now have the visibility of sensible fields
restricted, as well as the deletion can be prevented.

To do so, two new parameters were implemented in the access create
command: `restrict_visibility` and `restrict_deletion`.

In order to drop the delete restriction, users must specify
the `unrestrict` option while issuing the share access delete
command.

Depends-On: Iea422c9d6bc99a81cd88c5f4b7055d6a1cf97fdc

Change-Id: I31899a563c621e6f799e320fd990f9e510a8a9cc

commit_message:
[haproxy] Adds http/2 support to HAProxy

This change introduces haproxy_enable_http2 to let operators enable
http/2 on HAProxy frontends when kolla_enable_tls_external is enabled.

Change-Id: I2e00d3e9193a3052d43a228915ea249794490afe
Closes-Bug: #1850924
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible refs/changes/57/692957/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: {%- set external_tls_bind_info = 'ssl crt /etc/haproxy/haproxy.pem alpn h2,http/1.1' if kolla_enable_tls_external|bool else '' %} {%- set internal_tls_bind_info = 'ssl crt /etc/haproxy/haproxy-internal.pem alpn h2,http/1.1' if kolla_enable_tls_internal|bool else '' %}
deleted_lines: {%- set external_tls_bind_info = 'ssl crt /etc/haproxy/haproxy.pem' if kolla_enable_tls_external|bool else '' %} {%- set internal_tls_bind_info = 'ssl crt /etc/haproxy/haproxy-internal.pem' if kolla_enable_tls_internal|bool else '' %}

commit_message:
support notification vmoves for masakari

Masakari provides a new 'VMove' api, which could help users to gain insigh
into the process or result of the host recovery workflow.

Change-Id: I3da3024a8f34563bf0bff3924ce6ad8ac18a3018

commit_message:
Set 'tenant_name_discovery' parameter in 'polling' section

As of now 'tenant_name_discovery'[1] is being configured in 'DEFAULT' section in ceilometer config file.

As per Ceilometer this must be configured as a polling option[2].

[1] https://github.com/openstack/ceilometer/blob/master/ceilometer/polling/manager.py#L69-L80
[2] https://github.com/openstack/ceilometer/blob/master/ceilometer/opts.py#L98

Change-Id: Ib5c273df325f5ed0dccf7f45a9c7a91aba9568c3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-ceilometer refs/changes/36/892736/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: it { should contain_ceilometer_config('polling/tenant_name_discovery').with_value('<SERVICE DEFAULT>') } should contain_ceilometer_config('polling/tenant_name_discovery').with_value(true)

commit_message:
Add an option to randomize LDAP urls list

Since LDAP is now readonly, the current behavior might be
unexpected. By randomizing the list, we assure a more gradual
failure scenario if the first server on the list (as specified
by the user) fails.

Change-Id: I23f31bd85443784013a6aa158d80c7aeeb343993
Closes-Bug: #1953622
Resolves: rhbz#2024602
(cherry picked from commit 36d57d2a83a2a4a905337239d1a57d2e6a61c842)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/58/892758/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- features: - | A new option 'randomize_urls' can be used to randomize the order in which keystone connects to the LDAP servers in [ldap] 'url' list. It is false by default.

commit_message:
Allow multiple VIPs per LB

User can specify additional subnet_id/ip_address pairs to bring up on
the VIP port.

commit_message:
volume: Add Extension to volume v2 API

Makes our lives easier for migrating OSC, since volume v2 is still a
thing is some areas.

We reorder some methods in the v2 proxy, while we're here.

Change-Id: I1e4528f5a5d8e2caaaf204792ddcee7267e4c2e9
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstacksdk refs/changes/34/885134/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from openstack.block_storage.v2 import extension as _extension # ====== QUOTA SETS ====== # ====== VOLUME METADATA ====== # ====== SNAPSHOT METADATA ====== # ====== EXTENSIONS ====== def extensions(self): """Return a generator of extensions :returns: A generator of extension :rtype: :class:`~openstack.block_storage.v3.extension.Extension` """ return self._list(_extension.Extension) # ====== UTILS ====== def wait_for_status( self, res, status='available', failures=None, interval=2, wait=120, callback=None, ): """Wait for a resource to be in a particular status. :param res: The resource to wait on to reach the specified status. The resource must have a ``status`` attribute. :type resource: A :class:`~openstack.resource.Resource` object. :param status: Desired status. :param failures: Statuses that would be interpreted as failures. :type failures: :py:class:`list` :param interval: Number of seconds to wait before to consecutive checks. Default to 2. :param wait: Maximum number of seconds to wait before the change. Default to 120. :param callback: A callback function. This will be called with a single value, progress. :returns: The resource is returned on success. :raises: :class:`~openstack.exceptions.ResourceTimeout` if transition to the desired status failed to occur in specified seconds. :raises: :class:`~openstack.exceptions.ResourceFailure` if the resource has transited to one of the failure statuses. :raises: :class:`~AttributeError` if the resource does not have a ``status`` attribute. """ failures = ['error'] if failures is None else failures return resource.wait_for_status( self, res, status, failures, interval, wait, callback=callback, ) def wait_for_delete(self, res, interval=2, wait=120, callback=None): """Wait for a resource to be deleted. :param res: The resource to wait on to be deleted. :type resource: A :class:`~openstack.resource.Resource` object. :param interval: Number of seconds to wait before to consecutive checks. Default to 2. :param wait: Maximum number of seconds to wait before the change. Default to 120. :param callback: A callback function. This will be called with a single value, progress. :returns: The resource is returned on success. :raises: :class:`~openstack.exceptions.ResourceTimeout` if transition to delete failed to occur in the specified seconds. """ return resource.wait_for_delete( self, res, interval, wait, callback=callback, )
deleted_lines: def wait_for_status( self, res, status='available', failures=None, interval=2, wait=120, callback=None, ): """Wait for a resource to be in a particular status. :param res: The resource to wait on to reach the specified status. The resource must have a ``status`` attribute. :type resource: A :class:`~openstack.resource.Resource` object. :param status: Desired status. :param failures: Statuses that would be interpreted as failures. :type failures: :py:class:`list` :param interval: Number of seconds to wait before to consecutive checks. Default to 2. :param wait: Maximum number of seconds to wait before the change. Default to 120. :param callback: A callback function. This will be called with a single value, progress. :returns: The resource is returned on success. :raises: :class:`~openstack.exceptions.ResourceTimeout` if transition to the desired status failed to occur in specified seconds. :raises: :class:`~openstack.exceptions.ResourceFailure` if the resource has transited to one of the failure statuses. :raises: :class:`~AttributeError` if the resource does not have a ``status`` attribute. """ failures = ['error'] if failures is None else failures return resource.wait_for_status( self, res, status, failures, interval, wait, callback=callback, ) def wait_for_delete(self, res, interval=2, wait=120, callback=None): """Wait for a resource to be deleted. :param res: The resource to wait on to be deleted. :type resource: A :class:`~openstack.resource.Resource` object. :param interval: Number of seconds to wait before to consecutive checks. Default to 2. :param wait: Maximum number of seconds to wait before the change. Default to 120. :param callback: A callback function. This will be called with a single value, progress. :returns: The resource is returned on success. :raises: :class:`~openstack.exceptions.ResourceTimeout` if transition to delete failed to occur in the specified seconds. """ return resource.wait_for_delete( self, res, interval, wait, callback=callback, )

subject: Image filters should be dict not set
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2023-07-25 10:49:35.000000000', 'files': ['ci/roles/image/tasks/main.yml', 'plugins/modules/image.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ansible-collections-openstack/commit/0a371445ebd795470a234e19cfb2536701f71814', 'message': "Image filters should be dict not set

At the moment we generate a set as a filter for image checksums which
lead to AttributeError in SDK:
'set' object has no attribute 'keys'

With that we ensure that supllying checksum does not cause
module crash.

Change-Id: I490f51950592f62c9ad81806593340779bf6dbdb
"}]
commit_message:
Image filters should be dict not set

At the moment we generate a set as a filter for image checksums which
lead to AttributeError in SDK:
'set' object has no attribute 'keys'

With that we ensure that supllying checksum does not cause
module crash.

Change-Id: I490f51950592f62c9ad81806593340779bf6dbdb
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ansible-collections-openstack refs/changes/88/889388/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: filters={k: self.params[k]

action api-ref

Mixed up with job api-ref.

Change-Id: I53a5657f3d7d1e0432537e81743585c462c2b3dd

deleted_lines: The ``body`` attribute specifies contains a set of actions that gets created one the job is submitted. The ``description`` is the name that you give to the job. The name must not exceed 64 bytes in length. The ``job_schedule`` is very important to schedule the job or it will run only once. also you can provide ``event`` which can automatically start/stop the job.

commit_message:
NetApp ONTAP: Fix volume attachment with multiple HA pairs

This patch fixes the volume attachement operation filtering
the WWPNs that are passed to os-brick according to the HA pair
where the volume is created.

Closes-Bug: #1990846
Change-Id: I4cf37075b5bb9b57e92950f428ed4a240850ab88

commit_message:
Update SQLAlchemy, alembic and oslo.db, drop sqlalchemy-migrate

Bump SQLAlchemy to the 2.x series. sqlalchemy-migrate is not compatible
with SQLAlchemy 2.x so it is removed: any projects consuming upper
constraints will need to remove sqlalchemy-migrate integration.

We also bump oslo.db to 13.x since this is the first version with full
SQLAlchemy 2.0 support and bump alembic since recent versions also have
better compatibility with SQLAlchemy 2.0.

Change-Id: I23af86739e699bdcb42e1b112861497d35edc42e
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/requirements refs/changes/43/879743/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: SQLAlchemy===2.0.9

deleted_lines: import timedef _call_client_and_retry( client, url, retry_on=None, call_retries=3, retry_wait=2, **kwargs ): """Method to provide retry operations. Some APIs utilize HTTP errors on certain operations to indicate that the resource is presently locked, and as such this mechanism provides the ability to retry upon known error codes. :param object client: The client method, such as: ``self.baremetal_client.post`` :param string url: The URL to perform the operation upon. :param integer retry_on: A list of error codes that can be retried on. The method also supports a single integer to be defined. :param integer call_retries: The number of times to retry the call upon the error code defined by the 'retry_on' parameter. Default: 3 :param integer retry_wait: The time in seconds to wait between retry attempts. Default: 2 :returns: The object returned by the client call. """ # NOTE(TheJulia): This method, as of this note, does not have direct # unit tests, although is fairly well tested by the tests checking # retry logic in test_baremetal_node.py. log = _log.setup_logging('shade.http') if isinstance(retry_on, int): retry_on = [retry_on] count = 0 while count < call_retries: count += 1 try: ret_val = client(url, **kwargs) except exc.OpenStackCloudHTTPError as e: if retry_on is not None and e.response.status_code in retry_on: log.debug( 'Received retryable error %(err)s, waiting ' '%(wait)s seconds to retry', {'err': e.response.status_code, 'wait': retry_wait}, ) time.sleep(retry_wait) continue else: raise # Break out of the loop, since the loop should only continue # when we encounter a known connection error. return ret_val

environments certainly aren't.

commit_message:
Add volume to store Neutron L3 agent state files

The Neutron L3 agent stores state at state_path (/var/lib/neutron by
default) and it is expected that these files persist across restarts.

Change-Id: I739aaf9e2d0b2b2e7f7b8f60ef8c2111d6873cef
Signed-off-by: Adam Oswick <adam@adamoswick.co.uk>
Closes-Bug: #2009884

commit_message:
Adding support for image upload

Updating the functionality for upload_image method to make it
function similar to ``glance image-upload``.

Change-Id: Id04cbe4838048d7f510fbf78b4633cd4dc49b5d0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstacksdk refs/changes/39/881939/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: image, """Upload the data for an image. :param image: The value can be either the ID of an image or a :class:`~openstack.image.v2.image.Image` instance. image.data = data image.upload(self) return image
deleted_lines: import warnings container_format=None, disk_format=None, """Create and upload a new image from attributes .. warning: This method is deprecated - and also doesn't work very well. Please stop using it immediately and switch to `create_image`. :param container_format: Format of the container. A valid value is ami, ari, aki, bare, ovf, ova, or docker. :param disk_format: The format of the disk. A valid value is ami, ari, aki, vhd, vmdk, raw, qcow2, vdi, or iso. warnings.warn("upload_image is deprecated. Use create_image instead.") # container_format and disk_format are required to be set # on the image by the time upload_image is called, but they're not # required by the _create call. Enforce them here so that we don't # need to handle a failure in _create, as upload_image will # return a 400 with a message about disk_format and container_format # not being set. if not all([container_format, disk_format]): raise exceptions.InvalidRequest( "Both container_format and disk_format are required" ) img = self._create( _image.Image, disk_format=disk_format, container_format=container_format, **attrs, ) # TODO(briancurtin): Perhaps we should run img.upload_image # in a background thread and just return what is called by # self._create, especially because the upload_image call doesn't # return anything anyway. Otherwise this blocks while uploading # significant amounts of image data. img.data = data img.upload(self) return img

commit_message:
ironic: add enable_ironic_dnsmasq parameter

With the enable_ironic_dnsmasq parameter it is possible
to explicitly disable the ironic-dnsmasq service. By default,
the parameter is set to the value of enable_ironic

Change-Id: Icf94e5d6980ff238eac90e4f8cd8e530477a9c5b

commit_message:
Add an option to randomize LDAP urls list

Since LDAP is now readonly, the current behavior might be
unexpected. By randomizing the list, we assure a more gradual
failure scenario if the first server on the list (as specified
by the user) fails.

Change-Id: I23f31bd85443784013a6aa158d80c7aeeb343993
Closes-Bug: #1953622
Resolves: rhbz#2024602
(cherry picked from commit 36d57d2a83a2a4a905337239d1a57d2e6a61c842)

commit_message:
Return previous result of processed broker requests

Instead of returning an empty dict for already processed
broker requests, store the result and return it. This works
around issues in charms like ceph-fs that spin indefinitely
waiting for the response to a request that never arrives.

Closes-Bug: #2031414
Change-Id: Ie86f007d76fe75cc07cf7a973eff3f535a11dbe7

Add an option to randomize LDAP urls list

Since LDAP is now readonly, the current behavior might be
unexpected. By randomizing the list, we assure a more gradual
failure scenario if the first server on the list (as specified
by the user) fails.

Closes-Bug: #1953622
Resolves: rhbz#2024602

commit_message:
Release final os-brick for 2023.2 Bobcat

This proposed a release for os-brick to get any final merged
changes out prior to the lib freeze for 2023.2 Bobcat going into effect.

If the team is ready to proceed, please leave a +1 to acknowledge this
release and we will process right away. If the team is working on any
final merges, leave a -1 with some detail on the status and update the
patch with the new commit hash to use when ready.

Patches with no response will be merged by Friday, August 25th.

stack@rajat-devstack:~/os-brick$ git log --oneline --no-merges 6.3.0..bb730f3
71627c5 Fix unit tests when hostid file exists
1435059 Check paths before extending device
16c90d5 NVMe-oF: Create /etc/nvme/hostid
00caa73 RBD: Improve close and flush in IOWrapper
5996164 SCSI: Support non SAM LUN addressing
7571471 Fix multipath resize map with friendly names
c187a33 [docs] add autodoc_mock_imports
edc1bc4 nvmeof: Call findmnt with -v
4d41c29 mypy: Fix failing mypy job
2241a07 Bump mypy to 1.2.0
5926a4d LVM: Remove outdated comment
acd0265 linuxrbd: Remove rados_connect_timeout parameter

Change-Id: Icd4ca8c37cd958b7468c1afc6087e32464d21732
Signed-off-by: Elod Illes <elod.illes@est.tech>

commit_message:
db: Replace use of backref

Per the SQLAlchemy docs [1]:

  The relationship.backref keyword should be considered legacy, and use
  of relationship.back_populates with explicit relationship() constructs
  should be preferred.

A blog post is available to explain what's going on here [2] and might
be worth a read. The learnings from that blog post do have the benefit
of allowing us to simplify some existing relationships that had
unnecessary arguments defined.

[1] https://docs.sqlalchemy.org/en/14/orm/backref.html
[2] https://that.guru/blog/sqlalchemy-relationships-without-foreign-keys/

Change-Id: I882e9a918ab1a44b205fc86bbcbb6fef5209ab76
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Netapp NFS: Add online extend support

Add online extend support to the Netapp NFS driver by relying
on Nova to call back to the extend volume completion action.

This is adapted from the previous changes at
https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/cinder/+/739079
and https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/cinder/+/820578

Implements: bp extend-volume-completion-action
Depends-On: Ia62be2c50c121d016c10d489c12d452df50cd7d2
Change-Id: Iddb530369773e8c2a6d06b74cb40966fc4e064a9

commit_message:
[Negative] Delete a volume when one of the snapshot status is 'error_deleting'

The test validates delete a volume when one of the snapshots is not
"available" or "error", such as "error_deleting".

Change-Id: Id7168d755478493f44be32c8a47dc5bdac54de40
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder-tempest-plugin refs/changes/64/886464/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright 2023 Red Hat, Inc. # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import testtools from tempest import config from tempest.lib import decorators from tempest.lib import exceptions as lib_exc from cinder_tempest_plugin.api.volume import base CONF = config.CONF class VolumesActionsNegativeTest(base.BaseVolumeAdminTest): @classmethod def setup_clients(cls): super(VolumesActionsNegativeTest, cls).setup_clients() cls.admin_snapshots_client = cls.os_admin.snapshots_client_latest @decorators.idempotent_id('abcc0d5b-8f15-4ffb-aa75-717fe62733db') @testtools.skipUnless(CONF.volume_feature_enabled.snapshot, "Cinder volume snapshots are disabled.") def test_volume_delete_cascade_snapshot_error_deleting(self): # The test validates delete a volume when one of the snapshots # is not "available" or "error", such as "error_deleting" # Create a volume volume = self.create_volume() snapshot_list = [] for _ in range(2): snapshot = self.create_snapshot(volume['id']) snapshot_list.append(snapshot) # Reset snapshot status to error_deleting self.admin_snapshots_client.reset_snapshot_status( snapshot_list[0]['id'], 'error_deleting') self.addCleanup(self.admin_snapshots_client.reset_snapshot_status, snapshot_list[0]['id'], 'available') snapshot_get = self.admin_snapshots_client.show_snapshot( snapshot_list[0]['id'])['snapshot'] self.assertEqual('error_deleting', snapshot_get['status']) # Try deleting the parent volume with associated snapshots self.assertRaises(lib_exc.BadRequest, self.volumes_client.delete_volume, volume['id'], cascade=True)

subject: Fix temp volume project id for Tatlin storage
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-09-19 11:12:03.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/4173111f81645493d6e17cbe4642a21b777a9e76', 'message': "Fix temp volume project id for Tatlin storage

When creating temp volumes for snapshots Tatlin driver used
admin context. This led to volumes created with project id set
to null. The latter breaks 'os-hosts' tests because project id

commit_message:
Fix temp volume project id for Tatlin storage

When creating temp volumes for snapshots Tatlin driver used
admin context. This led to volumes created with project id set
to null. The latter breaks 'os-hosts' tests because project id
must be a string.

Closes-Bug: #1990134
Change-Id: I3ca3555c4a1f659501a97e7e518737cd151d748d

commit_message:
Set GLOBAL_VENV=false to fix broken gate jobs

Set GLOBAL_VENV=false in neutron-tempest-plugin-base
job definition to fix gate jobs broken by devstack
change [0].

Had to make the neutron-tempest-plugin-dynamic-routing-*
jobs non-voting as they are failing on the master branch
check queue. Work is still ongoing on a fix.

[0] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/devstack/+/558930

Closes-bug: #2031415
Related-bug: #2031526
Change-Id: I2cab7e9169ca6ddaea8b580dbb995e0886bd93c1

commit_message:
Fix unsafe interpolation in exec command

This addresses the following warning in the lint tests, recently
revealed by the fix in puppet-lint.

~~~
unsafe interpolation of variable '<parameter>' in exec command
~~~

To avoid an unexpected behavior caused by a flat string containing
multiple arguments, this enforces usage of array values.

Change-Id: I829e6095d96ae8bedd8ce480bf088fd759b7b56d

commit_message:
Fix unsafe interpolation in exec command

This addresses the following warning in the lint tests, recently
revealed by the fix in puppet-lint.

~~~
unsafe interpolation of variable '<parameter>' in exec command
~~~

To avoid an unexpected behavior caused by a flat string containing
multiple arguments, this enforces usage of array values.

Also, this updates the db sync class to append the config file to
the command instead of inserting it. The current implementation allows
users to run a different subcommand, which is not safe.

Change-Id: I0d37d29899d3e83348b9e1668b28cfa748731404

commit_message:
Unused param in stack unit test

This FAKE parameter only used in class Resource __init__ function
by '_syncronized' positional argument. it could be misunderstood
so i delete it.

Change-Id: I8e3bac6730de618a035eccc485d445e083a90079

commit_message:
mypy: cinder/volume/flows/api/manage_existing

Heavy dependence on taskflow, cinder.objects, and the db
layer (currently being refactored) in this code makes it
hard to reach a high level of coverage -- for now, just get
basic coverage and mypy passing.  This should be
revisited when a more complete way to handle cinder.objects
is in place (in progress) and when the db refactor finishes.

Change-Id: I74f071345e1debcda8c6eed9d49a6674eee5d4fe

commit_message:
Support k8s 1.27: Remove unsupported kubelet arg

This argument has been defined for containerd clusters in Magnum, and is set to
the default (and only valid) value of 'remote'.

Kubelet warning in 1.26:
  * Flag --container-runtime has been deprecated, will be removed in 1.27 as the only valid value is 'remote'
Kubelet error in 1.27:
  * E0801 03:10:26.723998    8889 run.go:74] "command failed" err="failed to parse kubelet flag: unknown flag: --container-runtime"

Change-Id: I072fab1342593941414b86e28b8a76edf2b19a6f

commit_message:
Do not ignore availability_zone in backup creation

This patch corrects a regression introduced by change
Ie2afb57c4861c4.

Change-Id: I8b1b09ecf2ad1e19a557a664516251cae3ddf2ae
Closes-Bug: #1912624
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/99/785099/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def get_az(self, volume, availability_zone): if availability_zone: az = availability_zone elif volume: az = volume.availability_zone else: az = None return az def get_backup_host(self, volume, availability_zone, driver=None): az = self.get_az(volume, availability_zone)
deleted_lines: def get_backup_host(self, volume, driver=None): az = volume.availability_zone if volume else None

commit_message:
Fix magnum-driver-manage for drivers without template path.

Some drivers may not have a template path, such as Cluster API

Change-Id: Ibb6bb4289ea6a3e7e7c8dd01e97641ce2292185e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/magnum refs/changes/28/892728/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: template_path = "n/a" # NOTE(dalees): Only drivers subclassing Heat have template definitions if hasattr(cls, "get_template_definition"): definition = cls().get_template_definition() template_path = definition.template_path template = dict(name=name, path=template_path)

commit_message:
Update Pure Storage NVMe Cinder driver

With the development of additional NVMe transport layers
for the NVMe driver we need to make the names used more generic
and add in the new parameter ``pure_nvme_transport`` to
define which layer the driver uses.

Options for this parameter are ``roce`` and ``tcp``.

Change-Id: I3f67f5ce4d85c2b7b77011e36ced73ed6e05179a

commit_message:
Add the os-extend_volume_completion volume action

Split off the finalization part of the volume manager's
extend_volume method and make it externally callable as the new
os-extend_volume_completion admin volume action.

This is the first part of a feature that will allow volume drivers
to rely on feedback from Nova when extending attached volumes,
allowing e.g. NFS-based drivers to support online extend.

See the linked blueprint for details.

Implements: bp extend-volume-completion-action
Change-Id: I4aaa5da1ad67a948102c498483de318bd245d86b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/57/873557/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from oslo_serialization import jsonutils def extend_volume_completion(self, context: context.RequestContext, volume: objects.Volume, error: bool) -> str: context.authorize(vol_action_policy.EXTEND_COMPLETE_POLICY, target_obj=volume) if volume.status != 'extending': msg = _('Volume is not being extended.') raise exception.InvalidVolume(reason=msg) try: with volume.obj_as_admin(): new_size = int(volume.admin_metadata['extend_new_size']) reservations = jsonutils.loads( volume.admin_metadata['extend_reservations']) assert new_size > volume.size, ( 'admin_metadata["extend_new_size"] is smaller or equal to ' 'current volume size.') assert type(reservations) is list, ( 'admin_metadata["extend_reservations"] is not a list.') except Exception: LOG.exception('Failed to retrieve target size and quota ' 'reservations from admin metadata.') msg = _('Required volume admin metadata is malformed or missing.') raise exception.InvalidVolume(reason=msg) with volume.obj_as_admin(): del volume.admin_metadata['extend_new_size'] del volume.admin_metadata['extend_reservations'] volume.save() self.volume_rpcapi.extend_volume_completion(context, volume, new_size, reservations, error) LOG.info("Extend volume completion issued successfully.", resource=volume)

commit_message:
[Pure Storage] Replication-Enabled and Snapshot Consistency Groups

Driver has always supported consistent group snapshot feature,
but the appropriate capabilites flag was missing.

Also added support for replication-enabled consistency groups.

Blueprint: pure-add-replicated-cg-support
Change-Id: I64bc4aa48d1d372b8687a22846aeece729e02598

commit_message:
Remove deprecated designate-agent

This patch completely removes the designate-agent service
and all agent related plugins.

Change-Id: Ibe4011fb85797282fa44742d4b9c9b7c00e78622
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/designate refs/changes/17/891317/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

import exceptions import designate.tests from designate.tests.unit.agent import backends class DjbdnsAgentBackendTestCase(designate.tests.TestCase): @mock.patch.object(impl_djbdns.DjbdnsBackend, '_check_dirs') def setUp(self, mock_check_dirs): super(DjbdnsAgentBackendTestCase, self).setUp() self.CONF.set_override('masters', ['127.0.0.1:5354'], 'service:agent') self.backend = impl_djbdns.DjbdnsBackend('foo') def test_start_backend(self): self.backend.start() def test_stop_backend(self): self.backend.stop() def test_init(self): self.assertTrue(hasattr(self.backend, '_resolver')) self.assertEqual(1, self.backend._resolver.timeout) self.assertEqual(1, self.backend._resolver.lifetime) self.assertEqual(['127.0.0.1'], self.backend._resolver.nameservers) self.assertEqual( '/var/lib/djbdns/root/data.cdb', self.backend._tinydns_cdb_filename ) self.assertEqual( '/var/lib/djbdns/datafiles', self.backend._datafiles_dir ) self.assertEqual( '/var/lib/djbdns/datafiles/%s.zonedata', self.backend._datafiles_path_tpl ) self.assertEqual([('127.0.0.1', 5354)], self.backend._masters) @mock.patch.object(impl_djbdns.DjbdnsBackend, '_check_dirs') def test_init_no_masters(self, mock_check_dirs): self.CONF.set_override('masters', [], 'service:agent') self.assertRaisesRegex( exceptions.Backend, 'Missing agent AXFR masters', impl_djbdns.DjbdnsBackend, 'foo' ) def test_find_zone_serial(self): class Data(object): serial = 3 self.backend._resolver = mock.Mock() self.backend._resolver.query.return_value = [Data(), ] serial = self.backend.find_zone_serial('example.com') self.assertEqual(3, serial) def test_find_zone_serial_error(self): self.backend._resolver = mock.Mock() self.backend._resolver.query.side_effect = RuntimeError('foo') serial = self.backend.find_zone_serial('example.com') self.assertIsNone(serial) @mock.patch('designate.backend.agent_backend.impl_djbdns.execute') def test_create_zone(self, test_update_zone(self): self.backend._perform_axfr_from_minidns = mock.Mock() self.backend._rebuild_data_cdb = mock.Mock() zone = backends.create_dnspy_zone('example.org') self.backend.update_zone(zone) @mock.patch('designate.backend.agent_backend.impl_djbdns.os.remove') def test_delete_zone(self, mock_rm): self.backend._rebuild_data_cdb = mock.Mock() test_exception_filter(self, mock_os_remove): self.backend._rebuild_data_cdb = mock.Mock() self.assertRaises( exceptions.Backend, self.backend.delete_zone, None ) @mock.patch('designate.backend.agent_backend.impl_djbdns.os.remove') def test_exception_filter_pass_through(self, mock_os_remove): self.backend._rebuild_data_cdb = mock.Mock() commit_message:
Fix server list command with -c option

Before this code, lower case code exists but does not work. so i
fixed it

Now we can use 'server list -c create_at' instead of use
'server list -c "Created At" in addition, you can also use existing column.
like 'id' or 'name'

Also, practical error message can be printed invalid input.

'Image Name'  modified it for consistency with --long option.

Change-Id: I86a113f27deafe35901a3ee15fe9cb24d4d5b145

commit_message:
tox: Don't share envdir between pep8 and fast8

This no longer works, so just drop it.

fast8: recreate env because env type changed from
{'name': 'pep8', 'type': 'VirtualEnvRunner'} to
{'name': 'fast8', 'type': 'VirtualEnvRunner'}

Tox stated here in 2022 that this functionality is
not intended to be supported:
https://github.com/tox-dev/tox/issues/425#issuecomment-1011944293

Change-Id: I99b36cb6c906872efa4c7f943001511af917c3be

commit_message:
Do not ignore availability_zone in backup creation

This patch corrects a regression introduced by change
Ie2afb57c4861c4.

Change-Id: I8b1b09ecf2ad1e19a557a664516251cae3ddf2ae
Closes-Bug: #1912624
(cherry picked from commit ddcf394ae277692d7cab2e03b4b6ae67ba7f1cc3)

added_lines: def get_az(self, volume: objects.Volume, availability_zone: Union[str, None]) -> Union[str, None]: if availability_zone: az = availability_zone elif volume: az = volume.availability_zone else: az = None return az def get_backup_host(self, volume: objects.Volume, availability_zone: Union[str, None], driver=None) -> str: az = self.get_az(volume, availability_zone)

commit_message:
WIP: Provide a mechanism for virtual kayobe enviroments

This adds an env-path option to kayobe. Kayobe will source this file
into its enviroment prior to running any commands.

When you pip install your config with the -e flag we can detect the config
source location. This reduces the number of steps needed to use kayobe i.e you
don't need to set KAYOBE_CONFIG_PATH and allows you to switch kayobe
environments by simply changing virtualenvs.

Change-Id: I7a297236d184967fcb48187a64e366617b689e9f
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/655424
Story: 2004367
Task: 30587

added_lines: src_path = resolve_egg_link('kayobe') if src_path: return os.path.join(src_path, *relative_path) return os.path.join(_BASE_PATH, *relative_path) def resolve_egg_link(package): sys.prefix, 'lib*', 'python*', '*-packages', '%s.egg-link' % package return f.readline().strip()
deleted_lines: sys.prefix, 'lib*', 'python*', '*-packages', 'kayobe.egg-link' realpath = f.readline().strip() return os.path.join(realpath, *relative_path) return os.path.join(_BASE_PATH, *relative_path)

commit_message:
WIP: Only generate relevant configuration in ml2_conf.ini

On compute nodes we end up with some neutron-server configuration in
ml2_conf.ini. This change adds logic to only generate it when necessary.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: Ic3c2c1c780973e46450c93bee83a59b72892ddd7

use of infrastructure VMs on a baremetal seed.

commit_message:
Make SNAT iptables rules persistent

SNAT rules are created on the seed hypervisor or seed host to allow
routing via this host immediately after provisioning overcloud hosts.
These rules are not persistent, so may disappear after a reboot. This
can lead to a loss of network connectivity after provisioning control
plane hosts.

This change adds a new role, iptables-persist, that persists all active
iptables rules. The role is executed in the SNAT playbook.

This role was adapted from Zuul's persistent-firewall role [1].

[1] https://opendev.org/zuul/zuul-jobs/src/branch/master/roles/persistent-firewall

Change-Id: I8e485d0ff5b0030d1d91c9d21417ede27c2ee2e6
Story: 2006487
Task: 36433
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kayobe refs/changes/39/679739/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # IPTables Persist This role makes all active IPTables and IP6Tables rules persistent. The role was adapted from Zuul's [persistent-firewall](https://opendev.org/zuul/zuul-jobs/src/branch/master/roles/persistent-firewall) role.

commit_message:
libvirt: Enable host daemon by default

Enable the libvirt host daemon by default. Also, support migration of
libvirt from container to host. The procedure is documented, and tested
in the upgrade CI jobs.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/kolla-ansible/+/835820
Change-Id: Ic2b5d7db5cd717544ee1c1d5886b6200186fcd48
Story: 2009858
Task: 44851
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kayobe refs/changes/34/835034/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # TODO(mgoddard): Remove this task when previous release is Yoga. - name: Clean up nova-libvirt container shell: cmd: > source {{ kayobe_src_dir }}/dev/environment-setup.sh && kayobe kolla ansible run nova-libvirt-cleanup &> {{ logs_dir }}/ansible/nova-libvirt-cleanup executable: /bin/bash

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-01-21 16:02:45.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/kayobe/commit/1b49f86e86e971e326fb4dd6f493f5a9be1cab83', 'message': "Allow more fine-grained groups for ironic, loadbalancer & network

Kayobe has fairly coarse-grained default groups - controller, compute,
etc, which work well in the majority of cases. Kolla Ansible allows much
more fine-grained placement on a per-service basis, e.g.
ironic-conductor. If the operator has taken advantage of this
fine-grained placement, then it is possible that some of the assumptions
in Kayobe may be incorrect. This is one downside of the split between
Kayobe and Kolla Ansible.

For example, Ironic services may have been moved to a subset of the top
level 'controllers' group. In this case, we would not want the Ironic
networks to be mapped to all hosts in the controllers group - only those
running Ironic conductor services. The same argument can be made if the
loadbalancer services (HAProxy & keepalived) or Neutron dataplane
services (e.g. L3 & DHCP agents) have been separated from the top level
'network' group.

This change abstracts the placement of Ironic, loadbalancer and network
services into separate variables, rather than referencing the top level
'controllers' and 'network' groups directly. These variables may be
updated by the operator to match the service placement.

Change-Id: Idbf181c795ee98ad653f11ae483f9dab4ef1b599

commit_message:
Allow more fine-grained groups for ironic, loadbalancer & network

Kayobe has fairly coarse-grained default groups - controller, compute,
etc, which work well in the majority of cases. Kolla Ansible allows much
more fine-grained placement on a per-service basis, e.g.
ironic-conductor. If the operator has taken advantage of this
fine-grained placement, then it is possible that some of the assumptions
in Kayobe may be incorrect. This is one downside of the split between
Kayobe and Kolla Ansible.

For example, Ironic conductor services may have been moved to a subset
of the top level 'controllers' group. In this case, we would not want
the Ironic networks to be mapped to all hosts in the controllers group -
only those running Ironic conductor services. The same argument can be
made if the loadbalancer services (HAProxy & keepalived) or Neutron
dataplane services (e.g. L3 & DHCP agents) have been separated from the
top level 'network' group.

This change abstracts the placement of Ironic conductor Ironic
inspector, loadbalancer and network services into separate variables,
rather than referencing the top level 'controllers' and 'network' groups
directly. These variables may be updated by the operator to match the
service placement.

Change-Id: Idbf181c795ee98ad653f11ae483f9dab4ef1b599
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kayobe refs/changes/31/825831/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Which host to use to deploy the ironic-inspector services for ironic. By # default this is none and all hosts in the controllers group are used instead. kolla_ironic_inspector_host:

commit_message:
Add introspection rule to update deploy kernel location

Back in the Ussuri release, we changed the Bifrost kernel location to
use ipa.kernel instead of ipa.vmlinuz. While this works fine for newly
discovered nodes, any node added to Bifrost in Train or earlier will
have kept ipa.vmlinuz as its deploy kernel.

This can cause issues since upgrading Bifrost or building new deployment
images will update ipa.kernel, but not ipa.vmlinuz, resulting in nodes
booting with an old kernel and a new ramdisk.

Fix by adding a new rule updating the legacy kernel location and
documenting how to update node information.

Change-Id: I6ae44dcae78424b4638762d015cf24336444707f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kayobe refs/changes/11/808111/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- upgrade: - | Adds an introspection rule to update the location of the deployment kernel registered in existing Ironic nodes. Nodes discovered on a deployment running the Train release or earlier may still be using the ``ipa.vmlinuz`` kernel, which stays unchanged when deployment images get updated. Existing nodes can be updated from the Bifrost container with the following command: ``OS_CLOUD=bifrost openstack baremetal introspection reprocess $NODE_UUID_OR_NAME`` If the ``kolla_bifrost_inspector_rules`` list is customised, the rule ``inspector_rule_legacy_deploy_kernel`` should be added to it.

subject: Allow overriding earlier use of NetworkManager
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2023-01-10 16:54:11.000000000', 'files': ['ansible/roles/veth/defaults/main.yml', 'ansible/roles/veth/tasks/RedHat.yml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/kayobe/commit/fde392d0b407fca795495c8b90987b15b42f74ca', 'message': 'Allow overriding earlier use of NetworkManager

veths have to be in nmconnection format, as nm-settings-ifcfg-rh has
no support for reading veth network-scripts, as can be seen by the
lack of a table at [1] "Table 37. veth setting". Hence why we're not
using NetworkManager with old network-scripts.

But if you set interfaces_use_networkmanager to true, you can already
start using NM on rhel8 platforms if you so wish.

[1] https://networkmanager.dev/docs/api/latest/nm-settings-ifcfg-rh.html

Change-Id: Ic4dd537bee826ee89c009bf2c4c95781af19cbad
'}]
commit_message:
Allow overriding earlier use of NetworkManager

veths have to be in nmconnection format, as nm-settings-ifcfg-rh has
no support for reading veth network-scripts, as can be seen by the
lack of a table at [1] "Table 37. veth setting". Hence why we're not
using NetworkManager with old network-scripts.

But if you set interfaces_use_networkmanager to true, you can already
start using NM on rhel8 platforms if you so wish.

[1] https://networkmanager.dev/docs/api/latest/nm-settings-ifcfg-rh.html

Change-Id: Ic4dd537bee826ee89c009bf2c4c95781af19cbad

commit_message:
Use merge_configs and merge_yaml to generate Kolla custom config

This patch adds new functionality - merging base & environment specific
kolla config. This allows you to place common settings in the base
configuration and only keep environment specific settings in the
environment directories.

Change-Id: Id4588f4529a4522e68e22ce58711cb927fa68a9d
Story: 2002009
Task: 42903

subject: Fix veth pair creation with VLAN interfaces
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2021-02-18 10:22:30.000000000', 'files': ['ansible/network.yml', 'releasenotes/notes/story-2008634-bdc6a4b4e6a55c22.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/kayobe/commit/839db3d8689d4a0f600ec2b43e714a4a6486a85d', 'message': "Fix veth pair creation with VLAN interfaces

Kayobe creates virtual Ethernet pairs between Linux and OVS bridges for
the Neutron external networks and Ironic provisioning and cleaning
networks. If these networks are defined as VLANs (as is commonly done
for the ironic networks), Kayobe should use the underlying tagged
interface rather than the VLAN interface to plug into the OVS bridge.

The issue being fixed here is that Kayobe does not create virtual
Ethernet pairs for these networks when they are defined as VLANs. This
may have been masked by the fact that typically the neutron external
network is a bridge, and the Ironic networks VLAN interfaces on that
bridge.

Example of a broken setup:

    external_net_names:
      - ext

    provision_wl_net_name: pwl

    other_net_name: br1

    ext_interface: br0

    pwl_interface: br1.42

    br1_interface: br1

This change fixes the issue by checking whether any network has a
bridge interface that matches the VLAN's parent interface.

Change-Id: Iabd57568fe42b27d65c4a858caddd4cadd4e9221
Story: 2008634
Task: 41874
"}]
commit_message:
Fix veth pair creation with VLAN interfaces

Kayobe creates virtual Ethernet pairs between Linux and OVS bridges for
the Neutron external networks and Ironic provisioning and cleaning
networks. If these networks are defined as VLANs (as is commonly done
for the ironic networks), Kayobe should use the underlying tagged
interface rather than the VLAN interface to plug into the OVS bridge.

The issue being fixed here is that Kayobe does not create virtual
Ethernet pairs for these networks when they are defined as VLANs. This
may have been masked by the fact that typically the neutron external
network is a bridge, and the Ironic networks VLAN interfaces on that
bridge.

Example of a broken setup:

    external_net_names:
      - ext

    provision_wl_net_name: pwl

    other_net_name: br1

    ext_interface: br0

    pwl_interface: br1.42

    br1_interface: br1

This change fixes the issue by checking whether any network has a
bridge interface that matches the VLAN's parent interface.

Change-Id: Iabd57568fe42b27d65c4a858caddd4cadd4e9221
Story: 2008634
Task: 41874
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kayobe refs/changes/14/776414/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- fixes: - | Fixes an issue with virtual Ethernet pair creation when the external, workload provisioning or workload cleaning networks are VLANs. See `story 2008634 <https://storyboard.openstack.org/#!/story/2008634>`__ for details.

commit_message:
service-ks-register: ensure all user roles exist

service_ks_register_user_roles is a list of user role assignments.
Previously the roles listed were not created prior to assigning them.
This change ensures they exist.

Change-Id: I9140083f41272515d4eca93e9310165bdf8add96
TrivialFix

commit_message:
Add fluentd_enable_watch_timer

By default, the watch timer in Fluentd is set to True.
To save CPU and I/O consumption this can be set to False.

When the watch timer is disabled, in_tail relies entirely
on inotify. In certain constellations, this may not work
reliably. In these cases, the watch timer is activated.

To be able to react in such cases, the watch timer must
be configurable accordingly.

Change-Id: Ic8ce6fbc3ed8f31d5d090e114b35703532679729
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible refs/changes/09/785309/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: enable_watch_timer {{ fluentd_enable_watch_timer }}

commit_message:
Modifies openvswitch tasks to exclude nodes with no openvswitch services

Modifies when clauses of OpenVSwitch post-config tasks. This is to make
sure the nodes targeted by them actually contain the services for which
commands are trying to be run.

Closes-Bug: #1971488
Change-Id: I97c74ad0279126747a836021ddb5b7f79440096c
Signed-off-by: Juan Pablo Suazo <jsuazo@whitestack.com>

commit_message:
Encode passwords in URLs

In various configuration file in OpenStack and side services,
URL can be declared to access database or RabbitMQ.

If you use special characters like `#` or `/` in the password,
then the URL is not declared as expected and related service
can't load correctly the URL, causing connection/authentication
issues.

To fix that issue, this patch encodes all passwords in all
the related variables and configuration files.

Closes-Bug: #1967897
Signed-off-by: Benjamin FÜHRMANN <benjamin.fuhrmann@ubisoft.com>
Change-Id: I7747949f9117f7669ce1cf8aefded4d96510d5e8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible refs/changes/65/841865/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: connection = mysql+pymysql://{{ venus_database_user }}:{{ venus_database_password }}@{{ venus_database_address }}/{{ venus_database_name }}?charset=utf8

commit_message:
nova-cell: add external_ceph_always_copy_cinder_keyring parameter

With the parameter ``external_ceph_always_copy_cinder_keyring``
the Ceph keyring from Cinder can be made available in the Nova
service, even if Ceph itself is not enabled as a storage backend
via the ``cinder_backend_ceph`` parameter there.

Change-Id: Ic5ec8de858960b6294e7cfbd1113e48f5dc40099

commit_message:
Enable HAProxy Prometheus metrics endpoint

HAProxy exposes a Prometheus metrics endpoint, it just needs to be
enabled. Enable this and remove configuration for
prometheus-haproxy-exporter. Remaining prometheus-haproxy-exporter
containers should be stopped and removed manually.

Change-Id: If6e75691d2a996b06a9b95cb0aae772db54389fb
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible refs/changes/18/877118/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- features: - | Remove configuration and deployment of prometheus-haproxy-exporter as it's repository is now archived. Instead use the metrics endpoint exposed by HAProxy directly.

commit_message:
CI: Use testinfra for post-deploy checks

This change refactors the post deployment check scripts into
testinfra [1] based test cases. This allows us to generate a report, and
makes it easier to add further tests in future. The pattern is based on
usage of testinfra in Kayobe.

[1] https://testinfra.readthedocs.io/

Change-Id: I184af9c919f649be2eb1eda2d192f13463c55ab1

Previously, firewalld rules were applied to configuration, then
firewalld reloaded to pick up all the new rules. Reloading firewalld can
be disruptive because it sets all chains to a DROP policy while building
up its firewall rules, breaking open connections.

Change-Id: I8e48b7827b33bdd2061d0e89c905bea8e29f60e8

commit_message:
Apply public firewalld rules immediately

Previously, firewalld rules were applied to configuration, then
firewalld reloaded to pick up all the new rules. Reloading firewalld can
be disruptive because it sets all chains to a DROP policy while building
up its firewall rules, breaking open connections.

This change switches to applying rules both permanently (to config) and
immediately, such that no reload is required.

Change-Id: I8e48b7827b33bdd2061d0e89c905bea8e29f60e8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible refs/changes/65/884365/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- features: - | Modifies public API firewalld rules to be applied immediately to a running firewalld service. This requires firewalld to be running, but avoids reloading firewalld, which is disruptive due to the way in which firewalld builds its firewall chains.

commit_message:
Support waiting for volume extend completion

Volume drivers can now signal to the volume manager to not finalize
extending an attached volume before notifying Nova, and instead rely
on Nova calling the new os-extend_volume_completion after handling
the volume-extended external server event.

This is the second part of the feature, see the linked blueprint
for details.

Implements: bp extend-volume-completion-action
Depends-On: Ifaca903a333b0b39ae87e6dc152b8fb2ec849989
Change-Id: Ia62be2c50c121d016c10d489c12d452df50cd7d2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/02/891602/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- features: - | Volume drivers can now signal the volume manager to wait with finalizing a volume extend operation on an in-use volume until an ``os-extend_volume_completion`` action is received for the volume.

commit_message:
Fix the docker container dimensions comparison for short notation

When using short notations like `1g` or `512m` to define the
container dimensions, we are always getting the container to
being restarted in each kolla-ansible run, even with no real
changes in the container configs.

Change-Id: Ic8e2dd42b95a8f5c2141a820c55642a3ed7beabd
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible refs/changes/00/886500/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- fixes: - | Fixes the dimensions comparison when we set values like `1g` in the container dimensions configuration, making the docker container getting restarted even with no changes, as we are comparing `1g` with `1073741824`, which is displayed in the docker inspect while `1g` is in the configuration.

commit_message:
Deploy Cinder backup with S3 backend support

Cinder is be able to create backups for volumes on Amazon S3 object based
storage.
Therefore, supporting the S3 driver as regular backup driver should help many
users.
Hence Kolla-ansible should deploy Cinder backup with S3 backend support working
out-of-the-box.

Closes-Bug: #1977853
Change-Id: I66217b6a365f961326c8d9b9605fe136cf9b3b63
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible refs/changes/98/844998/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Adds support for Huawei backends

Allows to copy Huawei conf files into the respective cinder containers
in order to facilitate the use of a Huawei backend with Cinder. To
copy the conf files, set the new variable `cinder_backend_huawei` to
`yes`, place the xml files inside `{{ node_custom_config }}/cinder/`
and declare them as a list in the `huawei_xml_files variable`.

Implements: cinder-huawei-backend
Signed-off-by: Juan Pablo Suazo <jsuazo@whitestack.com>
Change-Id: Ic8624b2e956b1f48f5fb96d6d8a0150b67236d20

added_lines: - include_tasks: external_huawei.yml when: - cinder_backend_huawei | bool - inventory_hostname in groups['cinder-volume']

subject: Enable HAProxy in AIO on multiple interface
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2023-07-07 09:16:51.000000000', 'files': ['ansible/group_vars/all.yml', 'ansible/roles/haproxy-config/templates/haproxy_single_service_split.cfg.j2'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible/commit/628e730128097fc49eb6a2310a0c717bfca2ebc9', 'message': 'Enable HAProxy in AIO on multiple interface

In some edge environment with a single physical node (all-in-one)
here is necessary to use a separated interfaces for internal and
public OpenStack API access, HAProxy have to bind only to the
external interface to proxy to the internal one, without binding
to the internal.

To enable this feature kolla_internal_vip_address and
kolla_external_vip_address must be set to IPs associated to the
real interfaces defined in kolla_external_vip_interface and
network_interface:

              eth0+------eth1
public -----------+ AIO +----------- internal
        10.10.10.1+-----+172.16.0.1

In /etc/kolla/globals.yml:
kolla_internal_vip_address: "172.16.0.1"
kolla_external_vip_address: "10.10.10.1"
network_interface: "eth1"
kolla_external_vip_interface: "eth0"
enable_haproxy: "yes"
enable_keepalived: "no"

Closes-Bug: #2026354
Change-Id: I3a70762245ab6379b51f53cbd3d2971f7bd06530
Signed-off-by: Ettore Simone <ettore.simone@gmail.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Enable HAProxy in AIO on multiple interface

In some edge environment with a single physical node (all-in-one)
here is necessary to use a separated interfaces for internal and
public OpenStack API access, HAProxy have to bind only to the
external interface to proxy to the internal one, without binding
to the internal.

To enable this feature kolla_internal_vip_address and
kolla_external_vip_address must be set to IPs associated to the
real interfaces defined in kolla_external_vip_interface and
network_interface:

              eth0+------eth1
public -----------+ AIO +----------- internal
        10.10.10.1+-----+172.16.0.1

In /etc/kolla/globals.yml:
kolla_internal_vip_address: "172.16.0.1"
kolla_external_vip_address: "10.10.10.1"
network_interface: "eth1"
kolla_external_vip_interface: "eth0"
enable_haproxy: "yes"
enable_keepalived: "no"

Closes-Bug: #2026354
Change-Id: I3a70762245ab6379b51f53cbd3d2971f7bd06530
Signed-off-by: Ettore Simone <ettore.simone@gmail.com>

deleted_lines: {% if with_frontend %} {% if with_backend and mode != 'redirect' %}

commit_message:
Deploy Glance with S3 backend support

Kolla Ansible should deploy Glance with S3 backend support
working out-of-the-box.

The S3 backend had been re-introduced in Ussuri after being
deprecated around the Mitaka timeframe, and having some local
object storage options is nice for testing and for eventually
setting up Cinder volume backups.

Closes-Bug: #1977515
Change-Id: I4ca58382d1ee568bfca2ad108495422163f81260
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible refs/changes/14/844614/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - name: minio_glance type: s3 enabled: "{{ glance_backend_s3 | bool }}"

commit_message:
CI: Add back ARA logging

Up till now the ARA plugin has been pinned to a very old version,
and is no longer functional.

This installs a much newer version of ARA and adds a README file
to guide developers on how to view the sqlite file.

This adds a per-task overhead to all ansible-running jobs. The
total impact per job varies between 5-15 minutes, and the logs
grow by about 6 MiB.

There's also an easter egg: developers can get Zuul to render the
ARA output for them. It's not enabled by default because the files
are rather large.

Change-Id: Id8328e374c9590b1363026fa2b2b24e191183987
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible refs/changes/97/891097/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Viewing ARA logs ================ What is ARA? ------------ [ARA](https://ara.recordsansible.org/) is an ansible plugin that collects a large amount of execution information and can render it into a browser friendly format. kolla-ansible CI enables the plugin and logs the sqlite output into the log directory next to this file. How do I view the output? ------------------------- You need a local installation of ARA: following the [getting started guide](https://ara.readthedocs.io/en/latest/getting-started.html) should help you with installing the `ara-manage` command. For small scale operations, you have a choice between using: * [a small embedded server](https://ara.readthedocs.io/en/latest/cli.html#ara-manage-runserver), or * [rendering the html to static files](https://ara.readthedocs.io/en/latest/cli.html#ara-manage-generate) For example, rendering a particular log to static html pages: ``` # (Use the "Download all logs" script from the Artifacts tab with DOWNLOAD_DIR=~/zuul-logs) python3 -m pip install --user "ara[server]=={{ ara_version.stdout | split(' ') | last }}" export ARA_DATABASE_NAME=~/zuul-logs/{{ inventory_hostname }}/ara-report/ansible.sqlite ara-manage generate ~/zuul-logs/{{ inventory_hostname }}/ara-report/ara-html ``` Is there an easter egg? ----------------------- Yes, there is! If the commit message contains the string `#generate_ara_html` then Zuul will render the html file and collect it in the logs. Beware: this adds hundreds of MiB to the log files. (Tip: the `#` shouldn't be the first character in the line)

subject: Use the upgraded image to run Nova upgrade checks
